intro: Robiquetia vanoverberghii, commonly known as the Vanoverbergh's rock rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and fleshy, blue-green leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the winter months. Robiquetia vanoverberghii is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient choice for xeriscaping.
